original_title: Sri Lanka to pilot two floating solar power plants with Korea support
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka will start two floating solar plants as pilot project with an 8.63 billion won grant from Korea, Cabinet spokesman Minister Bandula Gunawardana said.
The floating solar plants will be built in Chandrika Wewa (Reservoir) in the Ratnapura District and Kiri-ibban Wewa in the Moneragala District.

The cabinet of Ministers had given the go ahead to implement the project with Korea Institute for Advancement of Technology and for the Ministry of Energy to sign the required agreements. (Colombo/Mar14/2023)
